roleset.name: to scatter seed for growing

example.name: transitive
example.text: They sow a row of male-fertile plants [*ICH*-1] nearby , [which then pollinate the male-sterile plants]-1 .

example.name: with manner adverbial
example.text: But he and his chief financial officer , John Pope , sowed some of the seeds for the deal 's failure by insisting banks accept low financing fees and interest rates , while they invested in the transaction only a small fraction of the $ 114.3 million [*U*] they stoodto gain from sale of their UAL stock and options .
example.arg: he and his chief financial officer , John Pope ,
some of the seeds for the deal 's failure

by insisting banks accept low financing fees and interest rates , while they invested in the transaction only a small fraction of the $ 114.3 million [*U*] they stoodto gain from sale of their UAL stock and options

roleset.note: Based on survey of sentences in WSJ. Member of VNcls spray-9.7-1.
